exercise.description:
1. Grab a pullup bar with an overhand grip, placing your hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Lift your feet off the floor — or place them in the assist band — and hang from your arms.
3. Pull your body up to the bar by bending your arms and pulling your shoulder blades toward the floor.
4. Once your chin crosses the bar, lower your body back down.
5. Complete 1–3 sets of 8–12 reps.

1. Stand with a shoulder-width stance.
2. Grab the dumbbells with your palms facing each other.
3. Bending your knees slightly, and your core tight, bend over at the waist keeping your lower back tight.
4. Bending over until your upper body is at a 45-degree bend or lower, pull the dumbbells up towards your lower chest, on the side.
5. Keep your elbows as close to your sides as possible.
6. At the top of the movement, you should feel like you are pinching your shoulder blades towards each other.
7. Pause, and return the dumbbells to your starting position.

1. Position yourself on a bench so your left knee and shin are resting on it, as well as your left hand — this will be your support. Your right leg should be straight with your foot on the floor. Pick up a dumbbell with your right hand. Maintain a straight torso.
2. Pull the dumbbell up, aiming your elbow toward the sky while keeping it close to your body. Squeeze your upper back as you bend your elbow.
3. Slowly lower back down to the starting position. Complete 1–3 sets of 8–12 reps on each side.
test
test

1. Holding a dumbbell in each hand, hinge forward at your hips until your torso forms a 45-degree angle with the floor, allowing the dumbbells to hang in front of you, palms facing each other. Have a slight bend in your elbows. 
2. Engaging your core, lift your arms up and out, squeezing your shoulder blades at the top.
3. Slowly return to the starting position. Complete 1–3 sets of 8–12 reps.

1. Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet firmly on the floor and your arms extended over your chest, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Turn your hands in so your palms are facing, to “crush” the dumbbells up against each other.
2. Pushing the dumbbells together, slowly bend your arms to lower the dumbbells down just to the middle of your chest.
3. Extend your arms straight up and over your chest again, pressing back up to the starting position. Pause briefly at the top before repeating for 8-12 reps.

1. Lying on a flat bench place your hands up on the bar griping it slightly wider than shoulder width apart. 
2. Place your feet on the ground in line with or behind your knees. 
3. Create an arch in your lower back and push your chest up. 
4. Lift the bar up off the rack so that the bar is above your chest. 
5. Lower the bar directly down to the chest with your elbow pointing at approximately 45 degrees. 
5. Once the bar touches the chest, pause, and then press directly up again. 
6. Continue until all reps are completed and then re-rack the barbell.

1. Standing between the bars of a dip station, grip the bars with your palms facing inwards, keeping your elbows tucked in close to your body. 
2. Allow your body weight to hang so it is being supported by your arms and shoulders. 
3. Keep your hips straight. Lower your body by slowly bending your elbows and leaning slightly forward and continue down until you feel a stretch in your chest, shoulders and triceps. 
3. Your elbow joint should be at approximately 90 degrees at the bottom of the movement.

1. Sit on the chest press seat with your upper chest just above the horizontal handles. 
2. Make sure your feet are flat on the floor. 
3. Grasp the handles using a wide overhand grip and place your elbows out to the sides just below your shoulders. 
4. Push the levers out until your arms are fully extended. 
5. Lower the weight until your hands are at chest level.

1. Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with an inverted grip holding the dumbbells straight above your chest. 
2. Your palms should be facing each other. 
3. Place your feet on the ground in line with or behind your knees. 
4. Create an arch in your lower back and push your chest up. 
5. Slowly lower the dumbbells out and down to chest level in a half circle formation with a bend in your elbows. 
6. Lower the dumbbells to chest level. You should feel a stretch across your chest.

1. Sit on a chest fly machine with your back flat against the back rest and your feet on the floor. 
2. Grip the handles and make sure your arms are parallel to the floor. 
3. If not parallel, adjust the seat or handles accordingly. 
4. Exhale and slowly push the handles together squeezing your chest to the middle as you do so. 
5. Hold for a count of one amd return to the starting position.

1. Lying oh your back with either your arms by your side or hands under your glutes. 
2. Place your knees and feet together. 
3. Brace your abs and raise your knees up to your chest. 
4. Extend your legs as low as you can without touching the floor and repeat.

1. Lying oh your back with either your arms by your side or hands under your glutes. 
2. Place your knees and feet together. 
3. Brace your abs and raise your legs up to a vertical position. 
4. Lower your legs as low as you can without touching the floor and repeat.

1. Lying oh your back with either your arms by your side or hands under your glutes. 
2. Place your knees and feet together. 
3. Brace your abs and raise one leg up to a vertical position. 
4. Lower your leg back down as low as you can without touching the floor andat the same time raise the other leg.

1. Sitting on a bench with your legs over the end. 
2. Hold onto either side of the bench. 
3. With your back straight, brace your abs bring your knees up to your chest then extend your legs out as far as you can.

1. Hold on to a chin up bar with an overhand grip with your legs straight. 
2. Brace your core. 
3. Bend your knees and raise your knees up to chest height and return to the starting position.
4. Avoid swinging your body.

1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet raised off the floor. 
2. Brace your core. 
3. Hold a weight plate at chest height. 
4. Rotate your body to one side. 
5. Return to the starting position and rotate to the other side.
